Pros: Highly professional, collegial and positive culture.
Cons: My personal experience was entirely positive and rewarding.
Headline: Head Channel Management Canada

Pros: Relatively laid back, semi fair pay, as long as you get the work done no body bothers you
Cons: lack of leadership/management skills/no career opportunities, basically a dead end job.
Advice to Sr. Management: Reward your staff and actually appreciate them, a couple of meetings to inform everyone wouldn't hurt. Updates on direction of where the business is going, higher pay
Headline: Index Operations

Pros: Relaxed Environment, Benefits, No micro-managing,
Cons: Change takes a long time.
Headline: Great Enviornment

Pros: Depending on the group, work life balance can be OK (not investment bank hours)
Cons:
- Very old school way of thinking, behind the times on company initiatives
- All white male leadership and favoritism seems to go that way
- HR is an atrocity.  The worst I've seen in the industry. 
- Not competitive pay
Advice to Sr. Management: The whole culture needs to change and it needs to change from the top.
Headline: Stay away!!

Pros: Pay decent and good benefits.
Cons: Too much red tape, career paths not well defined
Advice to Sr. Management: Career paths should be better defined.
Headline: Analyst

Pros: As a freelancer, communication with the team was always smooth and their need were well articulated.  Response time was always fast.
Cons: I did not have any bad experiences while working here, except for the fact they did not have the budget to hire full time.
Headline: Great company to work for

Pros:
Great work life balance
Good compensation
Friendly environment
Cons: Can't think of any off the top of my head
Headline: Great Employer

Pros: Good group, smart, extremely qualified people
Cons: Some inefficiency relating to IT curbs productivity
Headline: Good work environment

Pros: Pay is fair, work/life balance is for the most part is reasonable.  Promotions and bonuses are done in a fair way.  Work force is relatively young and an intelligent group.
Cons: Long hours during certain times of the year.  Frequent breakdowns in technology resulting in delays.  Frequent team restructuring and promotions which seem to be done just to create the feel of career advancement.  Niche business with little relatable work experience in other more broad finance roles.
Advice to Sr. Management: Less middle management, more interaction directly with employees.  More transparency on career paths.
Headline: Overall a Good Experience

Pros: Allowed to work autonomously.
Cons: Poor job security in department
Headline: Manager

Pros: Small Firm vibes, despite overall company size. Great opportunity to learn through working with many departments.
Cons: Not many - a lot of opportunities to grow.

-The scale of which your work is seen is quite impressive since its a globally renown company

Cons: management, structure, pay, bonus, inequality, lack of recognition of staff
Headline: exposure to complex strategies, valuable experience, steep learning curve

Pros: Most groups have a great work/life balance and employees generally enjoy working for the company.
Cons: Be sure to find your way into the boys club and also the squeaky wheel tends to get the grease.
Headline: Overall positive experience, interesting company with potential to exceed competitors.

Pros: You work with very smart individuals that can help you develop as a professional. The company is owned by McGraw Hill but still feels like a small shop. There is some opportunity internally for high performers in years of plenty but you need to be in with the 'in crowd'. In general they try to do the right thing and i would recommend as a good career step.
Cons: Extremely political - very difficult to get decisions out of middle management, so many projects and other solutions fall short of optimal. There are quite a bit of 'dead weight' individuals which hurt any chance of improvement in daily operational processes and are protected by management because they're part of the 'in crowd'. This frustrates the hard workers who often leave because of it.
Advice to Sr. Management: Trim the fat and minimize the toxic environment created by toxic employees/managers/executives. There are more capable folks out there. Do the right thing and practice what you preach!
Headline: Interesting work with lots of bright people

Pros: McGraw Hill Financial has a great internship program with weekly events informing interns about the many different subsidiary companies. CEOs speak to the interns and there are fun activities including community service. S&PDJI was full of friendly people willing to share their knowledge. It was a great first internship.
Cons: Most of the employees have been in the company for awhile, but there seems to be a shift to younger people recently!
Headline: Great company, great summer internship!

Pros: People, Experience, Industry leader, Work life, Career progression
Cons: Politics and limited training outside job specific
Headline: Great experience and recommend SPDJI

Pros: They are a great work/life organization
Cons: There are no negative aspects.
Headline: Great place to work.
